name: Trigonometry - Right triangle vertex from an angle and hypotenuse
description: This tutorial will help you learn how to get the coordinates of the vertex of a triangle with a non-unit hypotenuse from its angle.

pages.textAfter: If the coordinates of a unit length triangle are (cosΘ, sinΘ), then changing the hypotenuse would move the vertex further away. This means that the coordinates of the vertex are (r*cosΘ, r*sinΘ).

pages.textBefore: In this example, the angle is 30° and the position of the parent node is at the origin (0, 0). And the link length is 2.
pages.textAfter: To get the position of the child node, add the position of the parent node to (2*cos(30°), 2*sin(30°)). The position of the child node is (√3, 1)
